label: Behavior 86749533
summary: Vessel behavior pattern: following a curved maritime route (the persistent small differences between COG and heading, combined with stable speed and gradual course evolution, suggest the vessel is navigating a predefined curved channel or coastal bend; position progression follows an approximately linear trajectory in geographic coordinates with slight northeasterly curvature, modeled by a second-order polynomial: lat(t) ≈ 54.0489 + 0.0558 × t - 0.0003 × t², lon(t) ≈ 9.3061 + 0.0226 × t - 0.0001 × t², where t is normalized time index from 0 to 1 over the observed segment)
description: Speed profile: stable (the vessel maintains a nearly constant speed of 6.5–6.7 knots throughout the trajectory)
Course change: gradual and consistent (COG decreases slowly and consistently from ~12° to ~0°, indicating a smooth westward turn)
Heading fluctuation: stable (heading remains within 0°–15°, showing minimal oscillation around the COG trend)

Behavior intent: following a curved maritime route (the persistent small differences between COG and heading, combined with stable speed and gradual course evolution, suggest the vessel is navigating a predefined curved channel or coastal bend; position progression follows an approximately linear trajectory in geographic coordinates with slight northeasterly curvature, modeled by a second-order polynomial: lat(t) ≈ 54.0489 + 0.0558 × t - 0.0003 × t², lon(t) ≈ 9.3061 + 0.0226 × t - 0.0001 × t², where t is normalized time index from 0 to 1 over the observed segment)
